name: Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad Company's Tax Assessment
name_abbreviation: Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad's Tax Assessment

judges: Before Fell, Brown, Potter, Elkin and Stewart, JJ.
parties: Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad Company’s Tax Assessment

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Elkin,
For the reasons stated in the opinion handed down, ante, p. 240, the decree in this case is reversed and record remitted to the court below with instructions to determine the proper ratio without including personal property, and when the ratio is so determined then to fix the proper valuation of the coal lands in question upon this basis, costs on the appeal to this court to be paid by appellees.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Elkin,

casebody.head_matter:
Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad Company’s Tax Assessment
March 29,1909:
(No. 2).
Argued Feb. 23, 1909.
Appeal, No. 371, Jan. T., 1908, by The Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad Company, from order of C. P. Lackawanna Co., Nov. T., 1907, No. 515, on appeal from tax assessment in the Matter of the Assessment of Land of The Delaware, Lackawanna & Western Railroad Company in Dickson City Borough.
Before Fell, Brown, Potter, Elkin and Stewart, JJ.
Reversed.
